page.title: 10 FLOODS IN BRUTON
page.content: Bruton has made the Guiness Book of Records in the past because of unusually heavy falls of rain.1982 proved to be the heaviest of all. At 11.20 p.m. on 11th July the rain began to fall.At 2.00 p.m. on 12th July the storm finally began to ease.The results of this rainfall had been tremendous.Everywhere was awash and under water;in some parts to a depth of 20 feet.The bridges were severely damaged and the river at a dangerous level. At Sexey's School,of all days the 12th July was a major festival with many important people due to arrive. The flat roof of the Science Block and the tennis courts looked like black water swimming pools.The class-rooms and boarding-houses were flooded and everyone was involved in bailing out. A day to remember in "sunny" Bruton!
